macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Tech Sector Selloff Continues as Nasdaq Falls 1.8% for the Week
items.summary: The Nasdaq Composite declined 1.8% for the week ending February 7, 2026, as tech-heavy stocks faced significant pressure. The S&P 500 ended the week down 0.1%, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 2.5%, reflecting a sharp divergence between sectors.

items.title: Software Stocks Hit Hardest as iShares Tech-Software ETF Falls 8.7%
items.summary: Software stocks experienced their worst week since April 2024, with the iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) declining 8.7%. The selloff reflects a broader rotation away from momentum-driven tech trades toward value and cyclical stocks.

items.title: Defensive and Cyclical Sectors Lead Market Recovery
items.summary: Consumer staples, industrials, and materials sectors outperformed this week, with gains of 6%, 4.7%, and 3.5% respectively. This rotation reflects investor shift toward defensive names and away from crowded AI and growth stock positions.

items.title: Healthcare ETF HTEC Declines 7.91% Over 10-Day Period
items.summary: The HTEC healthcare ETF closed at $35.05 on February 5, 2026, down 7.91% over 10 days with bearish technical signals from moving averages. Individual healthcare stocks showed mixed performance, with GSK up 6.9% and Novo Nordisk down 14.6%.
items.source: HealthTech Stock Market Sell Off Analysis

items.title: Market Volatility Spikes as VIX Rises 10.16% Amid Broad Rotation
items.summary: The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX) reached 18.00, up 10.16%, signaling increased investor uncertainty. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq both experienced their best days since November 24 on Friday before ending the week lower.
items.source: HealthTech Stock Market Sell Off Analysis

items.title: Value Stocks Surge 6.60% as Growth Stocks Decline 2.58% Year-to-Date
items.summary: A sharp rotation from growth to value stocks is underway in 2026, with value stocks gaining 6.60% while growth stocks have lost 2.58%. This reflects a market recalibration away from expensive AI-related positions toward earnings-focused investments.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Plunges to $60,000, Crypto Market Loses $2 Trillion Since October
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped to $60,033 on Friday, down over 50% from its $120,000+ October peak, amid regulatory uncertainty and Fed policy concerns, with the total crypto market capitalization falling $2 trillion since October 2025. Strategy reported a $12.4 billion loss, causing its shares to plunge 17%.

items.title: South Korean Crypto Exchange Accidentally Sends $40 Billion in Bitcoin to Users
items.summary: A South Korean cryptocurrency exchange issued an apology after erroneously transferring over $40 billion worth of bitcoin to users on Saturday.

items.title: Gemini Slashes Workforce and Exits Markets Amid Crypto Downturn
items.summary: US cryptocurrency exchange Gemini announced layoffs of about a quarter of its staff and withdrawal from several international markets due to the ongoing decline in digital assets.

items.title: Retail Investors Hunt for Crypto Market Bottom as Bitcoin Hits 16-Month Lows
items.summary: Santiment reports retail traders are analyzing for capitulation signs near potential bottoms, with Bitcoin dipping to $60,000—its lowest since October 2024—and the Crypto Fear & Greed Index at extreme fear level 7.

items.title: Bitcoin and Crypto Stocks Rebound Sharply on Wall Street Friday
items.summary: Bitcoin steadied above $70,000 after Thursday's plunge, boosting crypto-related stocks: Strategy soared 26.1%, Coinbase rose 13%, and Robinhood jumped 14%, amid a broader market rally.

items.title: US Clarity Act Stalls in Senate, Fueling Bitcoin Price Uncertainty
items.summary: While a stablecoin regulation law passed in July, the broader Clarity Act remains stalled, with analysts saying its passage is key for Bitcoin's sustainable recovery amid fading post-Trump election enthusiasm.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Crypto.com CEO Acquires AI.com for $70 Million, Launches Autonomous AI Agents
items.summary: Kris Marszalek, CEO of Crypto.com, purchased the AI.com domain for $70 million using cryptocurrency, signaling blockchain-AI integration. The platform launches autonomous AI agents today, February 8, 2026, with a Super Bowl LX ad, enabling users to deploy agents for tasks like trading and workflow automation.

items.title: AI.com Officially Launches with Super Bowl Ad Backing
items.summary: AI.com, acquired by Crypto.com's CEO, is set for official launch on February 8, 2026, featuring autonomous AI agents for consumer tasks. The rollout coincides with a high-profile Super Bowl commercial to boost adoption.

items.title: AI.com Domain Positions as Potential Front Door to AGI with $70M Sale
items.summary: The $70 million acquisition of ai.com by Crypto.com's founder aims to build a decentralized network of autonomous AI agents using blockchain for AGI development. Launching February 8, 2026, with a Super Bowl ad, it highlights crypto's role in AI infrastructure.

items.title: Tesla Launches AI Training Center in China Amid Self-Driving Competition
items.summary: Tesla has opened a China-based AI training hub to advance its Full Self-Driving software as Chinese carmakers accelerate L3 autonomous driving efforts.

items.title: China Trials Largest Locally Made AI Computing Resource
items.summary: China is testing its biggest domestic AI computing node, optimized for trillion-parameter model training and high-throughput inference in large-scale AI applications.

items.title: China Fines Companies for Fake ChatGPT and DeepSeek Services
items.summary: Chinese authorities imposed fines on firms offering unauthorized fake versions of ChatGPT and DeepSeek AI services.

items.title: China's Humanoid Robot Makers Shift Focus to AI 'Brains'
items.summary: Chinese robotics firms like Dobot are prioritizing vision-language-action models for real-world robot reactions over preprogrammed tasks, amid a commercial race.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Amazon Shares Plunge 7% Amid $200 Billion Capex Guidance for 2026
items.summary: Amazon's stock dropped 7% due to announcements of massive $200 billion capital expenditures in 2026 focused on infrastructure, custom chips, robotics, and projects like Project Kuiper. Investors worry about margin pressure and an AI investment bubble.

items.title: D-Wave Quantum Secures $10 Million Enterprise QCaaS Deal with Fortune 100 Company
items.summary: D-Wave Quantum announced a $10 million, two-year Quantum Computing as a Service (QCaaS) agreement with a leading Fortune 100 company. The deal highlights growing enterprise adoption of quantum computing solutions.

items.title: New CT Scanners and Biometric Kiosks Deployed at Airports in Canada, Australia, New Zealand
items.summary: Airports in Toronto, Sydney, Auckland and others are rolling out computed-tomography (CT) scanners allowing liquids and laptops to stay in bags, plus biometric kiosks to speed up security and identity checks ahead of 2026.
